J=8.5 Hz, 1H), 7.80-7.82 (d, J=8.5 Hz, 1H), 7.15-7.18 (t, J=2.0, 10.0 Hz, 2H). MS (ESI): m/z=267.0 [M+1]+.

Example 92-(6-hydroxynaphthalen-2-yl)pyrimidine-5-carboxylic acid

Followed procedure described in Step 1 of Example 7 starting from 6-hydroxynaphthalen-2-ylboronic acid and 2-chloropyrimidine-5-carboxylic acid with modifications: the solvent was dioxane/water (6/1), and the reaction was heated to 120° C. by microwave for 0.5 h. Purified by prep-HPLC. 1H-NMR (DMSO-d6 500 MHz): 13.70 (brs, 1H), 10.12 (s, 1H), 9.29 (s, 2H), 8.97 (s, 1H), 8.42-8.44 (d, J=9.0 Hz, 1H), 8.00-8.01 (d, J=8.5 Hz, 1H), 7.82-7.84 (d, J=9.0 Hz, 1H), 7.20 (s, 1H), 7.15-7.18 (dd, J=2.0, 9.0 Hz, 2H). MS (ESI): m/z=267.0 [M+1]+.

Example 104-(6-hydroxynaphthalen-2-yl)-3-morpholinobenzoic acid

Step 1: Synthesis of methyl 4-(6-methoxynaphthalen-2-yl)-3-morpholinobenzoateTo a solution of methyl 3-amino-4-(6-methoxynaphthalen-2-yl)benzoate (1.00 g, 3.30 mmol) (see Step 1 of Example 5) and DIPEA (1.70 g, 13.2 mmol) in anhydrous toluene (20 mL) containing catalytic amount of KI (100 mg, 0.660 mmol) was added 2,2′-dibromodiethyl ether (1.50 g, 6.60 mmol). The mixture was heated to 110° C. for 3 days. The mixture was concentrated in vacuo and the residue was purified by column chromatography on silica gel (PE/EtOAc=10/1) to give the product (1.00 g, yield 81%).

Step 2: Synthesis of methyl 4-(6-hydroxynaphthalen-2-yl)-3-morpholinobenzoateFollowed the BBr3 deprotection procedure described in Step 3 of Example 5.

Step 3: 4-(6-hydroxynaphthalen-2-yl)-3-morpholinobenzoic acidFollowed procedure described in Step 4 of Example 5, where reaction was run for 20 h at 25° C. The prep-HPLC purification (0.1% TFA as additive) gave Example 10 (54 mg, two-step yield 5.8%) as an off-white solid. 1H NMR (DMSO 400 MHz): δ 9.82 (brs, 1H), 8.00 (s, 1H) 7.80 (m, 2H), 7.74-7.60 (m, 3H), 7.39 (d, J=8.0 Hz, 1H), 7.13 (d, J=2.0 Hz, 1H), 7.08 (dd, J=8.8, 2.4 Hz, 1H), 3.52-3.47 (m, 4H), 2.80-2.72 (m, 4H). MS (ESI): m/z 349.9 [M+H]+.

Example 116-(6-hydroxynaphthalen-2-yl)pyridazine-3-carboxylic acid

Followed the two step procedure described for Example 7 starting from 6-hydroxynaphthalen-2-ylboronic acid and methyl 6-chloropyridazine-3-carboxylate. 1H-NMR (DMSO-d6 500 MHz): 10.16 (s, 1H), 8.71 (d, J=5.0 Hz, 1H), 8.51-8.4
